writing_prompts.title: Prized possession
writing_prompts.prompt: Describe an item you were incredibly attached to as a child. What became of it?
writing_prompts.source: 365 Days of Writing Prompts by Wordpress

writing_prompts.title: Escape!
writing_prompts.prompt: Describe your ultimate escape plan, and where you're escaping from.
writing_prompts.source: 365 Days of Writing Prompts by Wordpress

writing_prompts.title: The transporter
writing_prompts.prompt: Tell us about about a sensation-a taste, a smell, a piece of music-that transports you back to childhood.
writing_prompts.source: 365 Days of Writing Prompts by Wordpress

writing_prompts.title: Share the love
writing_prompts.prompt: Tell us about another blogger who has influenced your own online journey.
writing_prompts.source: 365 Days of Writing Prompts by Wordpress

writing_prompts.title: Third from the top
writing_prompts.prompt: Head to your favorite blog. Scroll down to the third post in the list. Take the third sentence in the post, and work it into a new post of your own.
writing_prompts.source: 365 Days of Writing Prompts by Wordpress

writing_prompts.title: Alma mater
writing_prompts.prompt: You've been asked to speak at your high school alma mater about the path of life. Draft the speech.
writing_prompts.source: 365 Days of Writing Prompts by Wordpress

writing_prompts.title: Turn, turn, turn
writing_prompts.prompt: For many of us, winter ins blooming into spring, or fall hardening into winter. Which season do you look most forward to?
writing_prompts.source: 365 Days of Writing Prompts by Wordpress

writing_prompts.title: Do-over
writing_prompts.prompt: Go back to a blog post you always though could be better, or were unsatisifed with-now, fix it.
writing_prompts.source: 365 Days of Writing Prompts by Wordpress

writing_prompts.title: Imperfection
writing_prompts.prompt: Imperfections-in things, in people, in places-add character to life. Tell us about an imperfection that you cherish.
writing_prompts.source: 365 Days of Writing Prompts by Wordpress

writing_prompts.title: Press it.
writing_prompts.prompt: Give some love to three blog posts you've read and loved in the past week, and tell us why they're worth reading.
writing_prompts.source: 365 Days of Writing Prompts by Wordpress

writing_prompts.title: Decisions, decisions.
writing_prompts.prompt: How are you more likely to make an important decision: by reasoning through it, or by goign with your gut?
writing_prompts.source: 365 Days of Writing Prompts by Wordpress

writing_prompts.title: Charitable.
writing_prompts.prompt: You've ineherited $5 million, with instructions taht you must give it all away, but you can choose any organization your like to be the beneficiaries. Where does the money go?
writing_prompts.source: 365 Days of Writing Prompts by Wordpress

writing_prompts.title: S/he said.
writing_prompts.prompt: Pause whatever you’re doing, and ask the person nearest you what they’re thinking about (call someone if you have to). Write a post based on it.
writing_prompts.source: 365 Days of Writing Prompts by Wordpress

writing_prompts.title: The satisfaction of a list.
writing_prompts.prompt: Who doesn’t love a list? So write one! Top five slices of pizza in your town, ten reasons disco will never die, the three secrets to happiness — go silly or go deep, just go list-y.
writing_prompts.source: 365 Days of Writing Prompts by Wordpress
